content:
From: Elsa L Gunter <egunter@illinois.edu>
Dear Isabelle Community,
I would appreciate some help with the process of typesetting
documents in Isabelle. In particular, I would like to typeset constants
(and type constructors) in a different font than that used for
variables. Is there any way that this can be done uniformly? I know I
can globally change the overall font for formulae by using, say,
\isabellestyle{tt}, but that changes both variables and constants. I
can change how each individual constant by is typeset by use of the
notation construct, together with \<^raw:_> feature, but this tedious
and error prone. It feels like there must be a better way, but I have
not been able to fine a description of such in the documentation.
---Elsa L. Gunter
